# eslint/no-shadow-restricted-names

<div class="rule-meta">
<span class="default-on">
âœ… This rule is turned on by default.
</span>
</div>

### What it does

Disallow redefine the global variables like 'undefined', 'NaN', 'Infinity', 'eval', 'arguments'.

### Why is this bad?


### Example
```javascript
function NaN(){}

!function(Infinity){};

var undefined = 5;

try {} catch(eval){}
```
